name: Tommi Mäkinen
bio: The quiet assassin from Finland, Mäkinen won four consecutive WRC titles (1996–1999) with Mitsubishi, combining icy calm with relentless speed.

name: Colin McRae
bio: The fearless Scottish legend who became the youngest World Champion in 1995. His flat-out driving and rivalry with Sainz defined the 1990s.

name: Carlos Sainz
bio: ‘El Matador’ remained one of the most consistent and tactical drivers of the 90s, fighting at the top with Subaru, Toyota, and Ford.

name: Richard Burns
bio: Burns matured throughout the 1990s with Subaru and Mitsubishi, known for smooth driving and technical brilliance — setting up his 2001 title run.

name: Didier Auriol
bio: The first Frenchman to win the WRC title (1994), Auriol was a tarmac master with a clinical approach that brought Toyota massive success.

name: Juha Kankkunen
bio: Though he peaked in the late 80s and early 90s, Kankkunen remained a force in the 1990s — a four-time world champion with unmatched adaptability.

name: Francois Delecour
bio: A fiery and fearless tarmac specialist, Delecour helped keep Ford competitive through the 90s, especially with the Escort RS Cosworth.

name: Kenneth Eriksson
bio: A key player for Subaru and Mitsubishi, Eriksson was often overshadowed but scored major wins and played a vital team role.

name: Gilles Panizzi
bio: The Frenchman was a tarmac specialist who shone in the late 90s, winning multiple events with Peugeot and showcasing his unique driving style.

name: Piero Liatti
bio: Liatti was a consistent performer for Subaru, known for his smooth driving style and ability to score points in tough conditions.
